{"step_by_step_thinking": "ASO (anti-streptolysin O) titre is a blood test used to measure the level of antibodies against the streptolysin O antigen produced by the bacteria Streptococcus pyogenes. A. ASO can be increased in school children: This is true. ASO levels can be increased in school children who have had a recent streptococcal infection.

B. May be negative in post streptococcal glomerulonephritis: This is true. ASO levels may not be elevated in post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis, as this condition is caused by a different immune response.

C. ASO titre included in major criteria in jones criteria: This is true. ASO titre is included as one of the major criteria in the Jones criteria for the diagnosis of acute rheumatic fever.

D. May not be elevated in 20% cases of carditis: This is true. ASO levels may not be elevated in approximately 20% of cases of carditis associated with acute rheumatic fever.
